messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] How many forum users does it take to change a light bulb
messages.msgSnippet: ***27 to point out spelling/grammar errors*** I dreamed about this list last night. I dreamed Kelly corrected my spelling and grammar. (and someone soitanly
messages.messageBody:
***27 to point out spelling/grammar errors***

I dreamed about this list last night.
I dreamed Kelly corrected my spelling and grammar. (and someone soitanly
should)

Dylan's dad is out of town and Dylan and I have been away a lot. We've
been hiking and camping and visiting friends. When we've been home we've
had company and I haven't had much time to post until last weekend.
Wow! The last few days were not the best days to try to catch up and
participate. It must have affected my tiny little mind because I
dreamed Kelly sent me a private e-mail telling me to proof read. <G>

It's good advice, Kelly, thank you.

There might also be five posts about how changing light bulbs could be an
indication of a serious disorder, ten posts about natural remedies for
obsessive light bulb changing and six posts in a row, from the same
person, about how her kids would only eat light bulbs all day if she
didn't tell them not to.

And at least one post from some smart ass who can't even find a light
bulb, who's going away again tonight and won't be back till Saturday. <g>

Deb L
